result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:05  INcludes 14CF188 , 15CF13, 15CF43, 15CF44, 15CF45  Defendant Randy Lee Meyer in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plead to Ct 1 in 14 CF173 and Ct 2  in 14CF188.  Remaining charges and cases will be dismissed but used for read in.  State requests a PSI.      Ct 2 173  Ct 1 14CF188 and CT 3 & 15CF13, 43,44, 45 are all to be dismissed.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 1 14CF 173 and Ct 2 14CF188   Facts are correct   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS Ct finds the defendant guilty of Ct 1 14CF173 and Ct 2 14CF188.    Dismiss Ct 2 14CF173 and Ct # 1 , 3  4  14CF188  are dismisses. 15CF45, 15CF44, 15CF43and 15CF33 are dismissed. Court orders a PSI  Defendant is to report to probation immediately today.
